pheasant Package¶

algorithm Module¶

calculus Module¶

pheasant.calculus.differentiate(fn, x, dx)[source]¶

Calculate value by differentiate to x power function, but an error to some extent. fn: Differentiate target function. x: Differentiate start point. dx: Delta quantity from x.

pheasant.calculus.diffn(fn)[source]¶

Make function to differentiate given function. fn: Differentiate target function.

pheasant.calculus.gamma(z)¶

Gamma function. Fractorial generalization. Value is approximated by Stirling’s approximation.

pheasant.calculus.simpson(fn, upper, lower, divnum=1000)[source]¶

Definite integral by simpson method.

pheasant.calculus.trapezoid(upper, lower, divnum, func)[source]¶

Integral caluclation by trapezoid approximation.

geometry Module¶

grptheory Module¶

class pheasant.grptheory.AlgebraicStructureFactory[source]¶

Abstract Factory to make algebraic structure.

create(axiom, elements)[source]¶

If elements satisfy axiom, make structure according to the axiom.

class pheasant.grptheory.Axiom[source]¶

An axiom, group, ring, field...

define()[source]¶

Get initializer of algebraic structure correspond to the axiom.

satisfy(target)[source]¶

Is target satisfy the axiom?

class pheasant.grptheory.Element[source]¶

Element in group.

operate()[source]¶

Carry out an operation.

class pheasant.grptheory.Field[source]¶

Field expression class.

class pheasant.grptheory.Group(elements)[source]¶

Group expression class.

class pheasant.grptheory.GroupAxiom[source]¶

Bases: pheasant.grptheory.Axiom

An group axiom.

define()[source]¶

Get definition of algebraic structure, in a word Group class return.

satisfy(target)[source]¶

Is target satisfy group axiom?

class pheasant.grptheory.Ring[source]¶

Ring expression class.

logic Module¶

Indicates pattern match failure.

pheasant.logic.FAIL = None¶

Indicates pattern match success, with no valiables.

class pheasant.logic.Symbol(value)[source]¶

Bases: object

Symbol type class as that in Lisp.

pheasant.logic.natp(n)[source]¶

Is n Natural Number?.

pheasant.logic.unify(u, v)¶

Unification substitution.

settheory Module¶

class pheasant.settheory.Event(elements)[source]¶

This class is to express event in probability theory.

Is self and target bijection?

emptyp()[source]¶

Is this event empty event?

exclusivep(target)[source]¶

Is self elements and target elements exclusive?

injectp(target)[source]¶

Is self and target injection?

surjectp(target)[source]¶

Is self and target surjection?

Is s1 and s2 exclusive?

pheasant.util.makelist(length, initvalue=None)[source]¶

make standard list requested length [object]*length is all value equal object.

pheasant.util.nearchoice(target, sample)[source]¶

choice near value key is number type only. but should be modified algorithm.

pheasant.util.normalize_formula(form, target)[source]¶

make 1 for simultanious linear equations

pheasant.util.numdigits(n)¶

Get number of digits. Minus sign is not count. I wish I add “len” method to int class.

pheasant.util.rands(start, end, size)[source]¶

pheasant.util.readcsv(path)[source]¶

pheasant.util.sleq(formulas)[source]¶

simultanious linear equations formura length 2 (so 2 dimention), should be inverse matrix use. but if LU resolve masterd, should be attempt to use it.

pheasant.util.subtraction_formulas(formulas, target)[source]¶

pheasant.util.swap(a, b)[source]¶

pheasant.util.tarai(x, y, z)[source]¶

Tarai function.(Takeuchi function) Used at benchmark.

pheasant.util.zipter(ls1, ls2, func=None)¶

Operate as “zip” and “filter”.
